clinical_study.brief_title: Efficacy and Safety of Oral Alitretinoin (Toctino®) in the Treatment of Patients With Cutaneous Lupus Erythematosus
clinical_study.official_title: Efficacy and Safety of Oral Alitretinoin (Toctino®) in the Treatment of Patients With Cutaneous Lupus Erythematosus: A Multicentre, Open-Label, Prospective Pilot Study

brief_summary.textblock: To evaluate the therapeutic effect of oral alitretinoin (Toctino®) in the treatment of CLE with respect to proportion of responders based on the Revised Cutaneous Lupus Disease Area and Severity Index (RCLASI) activity score for skin lesions at baseline and after 24 weeks of treatment or at the latest assessment for patients who withdrew prematurely. Response is defined as a reduction of 50% in the total RCLASI compared to the baseline value ("RCLASI 50").

primary_outcome.measure: Primary efficacy outcome is the response rate at week 24 or at the latest assessment for patients who withdrew prematurely.
primary_outcome.time_frame: Week 24 or at the latest assessment for patients who withdrew prematurely.
primary_outcome.description: Response is defined as a reduction of 50% in the total RCLASI activity for skin lesions, compared to the baseline value ("RCLASI 50")

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of patients with RCLASI 50 at week 12 of treatment.
Proportion of patients with at least partial response at end of therapy (with regard to RCLASI activity score for skin lesions).
Patient's global assessment and VAS for itch and pain 12 weeks after the beginning of treatment.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 12 weeks after the beginning of treatment

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants with Adverse Events (AEs) and their severity.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 24 weeks of treatment + 5 weeks of follow up

secondary_outcome.measure: Patient's global assessment and VAS for itch and pain at the end of therapy.

intervention.description: 1 capsule Alitretinoin 30 mg per day; optional reduction to 10 mg per day in case unacceptable adverse reactions to the higher dose occur

overall_official.affiliation: Department of Dermatology, University Hospital Muenster, Muenster, Germany
